snippet: Audiences fed up with a radical director's take on an opera usually save their rage till the final curtain calls. At a performance Monday night of Cherubini's "Médée" at the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées, the audience didn't wait.
abstract: Audiences fed up with a radical director's take on an opera usually save their rage till the final curtain calls. At a performance Monday night of Cherubini's "Médée" at the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées, the audience didn't wait.

headline.main: Melee at the Opera: Catcalls for Paris 'Médée'
